com.pb.sawdust.tabledata

Interface DataColumn<T>

  • Type Parameters:
    T - The type of data held by this data column.
    All Superinterfaces:
    java.lang.Iterable<T>
    All Known Implementing Classes:
    AbstractDataColumn, BasicDataColumn, BooleanDataColumn, ByteDataColumn, DoubleDataColumn, FloatDataColumn, IntegerDataColumn, LongDataColumn, ShortDataColumn, StringDataColumn

    public interface DataColumn<T>
extends java.lang.Iterable<T>

    The DataColumn interface provides a framework through which columns of a DataTable can be accessed. It allows access to greater column information than would a simple list of values. It avoids any explicit connection to a data table, except through the optional getCellByKey(Object) method. This both simplifies the interface and allows it to be independant of a data source, though its label and type (generally specified in the data table schema) are accesible here.

    An implementation specifies its type through its generic parameter as well as through an explicit DataType. It is required that these two will be coordinated and consistent; both are required to allow type safety and inference. Specifically, if column is a DataColumn<K> instance on a DataTable instance table, K must be the class reference corresponding to table.getColumnDataType(column.getLabel()).getObjectClass(). To ensure that this contract is fulfilled, one of the data column wrapper classes (BooleanDataColumn, IntegerDataColumn, etc.) should generally be used. In addition, by specifying the generic type explicitly, type erasure in these wrapper classes is avoided, which prevents the need for annoying (and seemingly superfluous) casts.

      • getCell

        T getCell(int rowNumber)
        Get the column value at a given index. Indices are 0-based, for reason described in DataTable.
        Parameters:
        rowNumber - The (0-based) number of the column value to retrieve.
        Returns:
        the column value at rowIndex.

      • getCellByKey

        <K> T getCellByKey(K key)
        Get the column value at a specified key location. This method is optional and requires some sort of access to the primary key of the source data set. Whether the primary key is dynamic (i.e. changing the key on the data table will cause this method to refer to the new key) is implemntation specific.
        Parameters:
        key - The key value of the row whose column value is to be retrieved.
        Returns:
        the column value corresponding to key.
        Throws:
        java.lang.UnsupportedOperationException - if this method is not implemented.
        TableDataException - if the type of key does not correspond to key's getColumnType() method, or if the key is invalid (not located in the column's primary key).
        See Also:
        TableKey.getKeyColumnType()
